On 10/14/05, Mark McKeown <zzalsmm3@...> wrote:
> Maybe someon=
e will find this interesting.

I find it very interesting.  Haven't complet=
ely digested yet, but will
re-study over weekend.

I was a member of the Gr=
idForum Transaction Management Research Group.
Final report:
http://forge.g=
ridforum.org/projects/tm-rg/document/Report_of_the_Transaction_Management_R=
esearch_Group/en/4
Use cases:
http://forge.gridforum.org/projects/tm-rg/doc=
ument/Transaction_Use_cases/en/4

Your "hold" concept is very similar to wh=
at some of us called the
"provisional-final" transaction pattern and what o=
thers called
"Options".

We didn't consider Paxos, but it was mentioned in =
side discussions. 
(Ran out of time and chairs.)

I personally thought REST=
 would be better than some of the
architectures we discussed, but I was the=
 only member of the group who
held this opinion.  I think that some variati=
on on a provisional-final
pattern would fit well into a REST architecture.
=

One quibble:  2-phase commit does not require resource locking. That's
onl=
y the ACID rules, and even then, paraphrasing something I think Roy
Fieldin=
g said on this list, how the resource manager protects its
resources is its=
 own business and others won't know anyway.
